name: Path N Ovary
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a pelvic lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (FIGO considers such cases as pNX). (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in the field distant metastasis. 

**Note 3:** Regional nodes include bilateral and contralateral named nodes. 

**Note 4:**  Federation Internationale de Gynecologie at d-Obstetrique (FIGO) Stage IIIC is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code regional lymph nodes based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage IIIC only if it is known that the stage value is assigned because of lymph node involvement. 

**Note 5:**  If the clinician says "adnexa palpated" but doesn't mention lymph nodes, assume lymph nodes are not involved, assign N0.

**Note 5:**  If either exploratory or definitive surgery is done with no mention of lymph nodes, assume regional nodes are not involved.

**Regional lymph nodes:**

  **Regional lymph nodes:**

    Aortic:
        Lateral (lumbar)
        Para-aortic
        Periaortic
    Iliac:
       Common iliac
       External iliac
       Internal iliac (hypogastric):
           Obturator     
                Inguinal
    Intra-abdominal
    Pelvic
    Subdiaphragmatic
  
    Retroperitoneal, NOS
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 225
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

FIGO IIIC based on regional lymph node involvement

Stated as N1
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically

Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology
In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
